intro: Meconopsis inaperta, commonly known as the Himalayan blue poppy, is a species of flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and is typically found in alpine meadows at high elevations. The plant has palmate leaves and produces showy flowers that bloom in early summer. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, Meconopsis inaperta is considered a rare and endangered species.
